The Congolese health ministry says another five confirmed cases of Ebola have been found and Democratic Republic of Congo as health workers struggle to contain the disease
The world Health Organization says there are one hundred thirty five confirmed cases of the disease more than two months since the outbreak was declared
Health workers face a number of obstacles in fighting Ebola virus circulating in the eastern part of the country where there have been frequent violent clashes between armed groups and the government many people don't trust health workers and won't let them into the villages
I'm Janine hurts and you're listening to NPR News from Washington
